abstract.text: Calculate the input rectangle needed for the given image input and the output tile to be rendered.

inlineContent.text: The bounds of input tile for this input that will be needed to render the output tile. This method must calculate this value.
The index of the input image for which the tile bounds have been requested. This index matches the order of images in the
array below.
An
of image tiles representing the input images. This image will not yet contain any pixel data, just the image bounds, pixel transforms, and other data describing the image.
The bounds of the output tile, given to you by the host application.
The output image. This image will not yet contain any pixel data, just the image bounds and other data about the output image.
The NSData returned from your plug-in’s
method.
The rational time at which the output will be rendered.

This method is called for each image input your plug-in has requested. Use the passed-in information to calculate the portion of the current input image that you’ll need to render the output tile that will be rendered next.

abstract.text: Render only the necessary tiles of an image in your FxPlug plug-in to improve efficiency.
Exchange data with Final Cut Pro, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.
An image tile object that is passed between an out-of-process FxPlug plug-in and a host application.
A 2D axis-aligned rectangle with integer coordinates.
Compares two rectangle structures and determines if they are equal.
The designated initializer for your plug-in for rendering only certain portions of the plug-in’s output, referred to as tiles.
Calculates the bounds of the output image determined by the various inputs and plug-in state at the given render time.
Retrieves the plug-in’s parameter values, performs any calculations it needs to from those values, and packages up the result to be used later with rendering.
Calculate the input rectangle needed for the given image input and the output tile to be rendered.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.

your plug-in can fill out with the details of what went wrong when a failure occurs in this method. If there was an error, your plug-in should also return

value.text: A static byte buffer in memory.
